scenarioDescription:
The GJ 1132 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 1132 is a star with 0.18 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.21 times its radius. It is located 41.14 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

GJ 1132 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 1132 system


GJ 1132 b

GJ 1132 b was discovered by the Cerro Tololo Inter-American Observatory observatory, in 2015-11, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 1132 b is 1.660 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 1132 b is 1.130 that of Earth. At 1.660 Earth masses, GJ 1132 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


GJ 1132 c

GJ 1132 c was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2017-10, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 1132 c is 2.643 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 1132 c is 1.430 that of Earth. At 2.643 Earth masses, GJ 1132 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system GJ 1132, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the Cerro Tololo Inter-American Observatory.
name: GJ 1132 - System With 2 Exolanets
